summary:
The heart tree there was a great oak, its ancient limbs 
overgrown with smokeberry vines; they knelt before it to offer their...
caption: The heart tree there was a great oak, its ancient limbs overgrown with smokeberry vines; they knelt before it to offer their thanksgiving, as if it had been a weirwood. Sansa drifted to sleep as the moon rose, Arya several hours later, curling up in the grass under Ned’s cloak. All through the dark hours he kept his vigil alone. When dawn broke over the city, the dark red blooms of dragon’s breath surrounded the girls where they lay. “I dreamed of Bran,” Sansa had whispered to him. “I saw him smiling.”

title: The Bartender
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2wSN2e0

by MrsAlwaysWrite

Sandor frequents the small town bar with his friends to relax and have a good time. Things change though when a beautiful, red-headed bartender begins working there. Soon, its not the beer and game of pool that continues to draw him back.

Words: 7711, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

  • Additional Tags: Romance, Some angst, Firefighters, I Will Go Down With This Ship, One Shot, Well supposed to be a one shot…, Humor, Fluff and Smut, Sex, Some Swearing, Implied/Referenced Abuse

summary:
Bowled Over by Jillypups - Chapter 14
They’re out front waiting for the police whom Sansa called the moment it dawned on her...
body:
Bowled Over by Jillypups - Chapter 14

They’re out front waiting for the police whom Sansa called the moment it dawned on her that her literal bread and butter was just stolen right out from underneath her. The clouds have gone away completely now, and Christ how she longs for the fire and brimstone of a good thunderstorm, something more torrential to match the windstorm whipping inside her. Instead she’s betrayed by a robin’s egg blue sky and a bright merry sun, warm breezes that bring the whine of cicadas and crickets.

Show Chapter | Archive of Our Own

summary: Dire che Arya sarebbe sopravvissuta a KL mentre se Sansa fosse stata al posto di Arya no, mi crea due problemi: Il primo è la...
body:
Dire che Arya sarebbe sopravvissuta a KL mentre se Sansa fosse stata al posto di Arya no, mi crea due problemi:

Il primo è la sottile superiorità di Arya rispetto alla sorella ( Arya può fare tutto quello che ha fatto Sansa, ma Sansa no) cosa che non condividerò mai. La seconda è la motivazione delle buone maniere.

Per la prima, ho adorato la settima stagione perchè le due sorelle finalmente trovano nelle loro differenze e mancanze non più un punto di disaccordo, ma di unione. Entrambe riconoscono cosa possono e non possono fare, affidandosi all'altra in base alle circostanze. E questo è un messaggio che mi è piaciuto tantissimo. Poichè sono i personaggi stessi a parlare di questo, sinceramente mi fido più delle loro parole, che della percezione dei fan: nessuno conosce Arya meglio di Arya stessa.


Per la motivazione:

A tre anni, Sansa era già una lady. Sempre così delicata, così desiderosa di compiacere. Più di ogni altra cosa, amava le storie di valore cavalieresco. 

L'arco narrativo della maggiore delle sorelle Stark, prende tutto ciò e lo trasforma in un incubo, esattamente come fa con Arya ed il suo arco. La storia di Sansa è una metafora della violenza domestica.  Quello che succede a KL è più di sapere le buone maniere e fare la riverenza: Sansa le sapeva fare perfettamente, ma non le è servito ad evitarsi i pestaggi. è la pazienza, la resilienza, il sapere quando tacere e quando parlare. E anche come parlare e a chi. è la conoscenza della storia e delle casate di Westeros unita al sapere ascoltare e osservare, ad averla tenuta in vita. è, ( citando il Mastino) dando a Joffrey quello che voleva senza dargli effettivamente nulla. Per questo credo che Arya all'età di nove anni, in questo frangente non sarebbe sopravvissuta: sono altre le caratteristiche richieste per questa “missione”, caratteristiche, che non vedo in Arya.

blog.name: emmsisi

blog.description: SanSan, writing, my babies, dogs, cake, coffee and metal

title: North - one-shot Sansan
body:
Just sharing this old abandoned fic (re-purposed into a one-shot) as @queen-perry1 also mentioned wanting an ABO-verse Sansan with an alpha Sansa and omega Sandor - yay, I’m not the only one!

This is kind of an ABO-verse Blackwater AU, but all emotions and no smut (sorry!), and a bit of a mess, but since it was more or less written and rotting on my hard drive, well, here it is. :-)

North - on AO3

blog.name: sansadaynes
blog.title: #bringbacklindapark
blog.description: Zoe, 23. always falling in love with the side characters that never show up again.

tags: a song of ice and fire
i just know lf's downfall in the books is going to be epic
the show scene was good but not as epic as it should have been
because ppl seem to forget that lf almost single handedly set the whole realm to chaos
but in doing so he's racked up tons of key characters as witnesses
so more key characters should have been there to see his downfall
you have sansa tyrion sandor varys jeyne even lady stoneheart
if sweetrobin lives then he's a witness
and thats not even including the smaller characters that get ignored
also i hoooooope sansa maybe quotes cersei's 'love is poison' line
when petyr begs for his life saying he loves her

blog.name: meggiry-khaleesi
blog.title: Not a dancer. A khaleesi. But also a dancer.
blog.description: Mademoiselle Meg Giry from The Phantom of the Opera is the dancer, not me. She's a badass ballerina babe who don't take no guff. I also tend to write and reblog a lot of SanSan meta from Game of Thrones.

summary: El cambio de opinión de GRRM sobre Sansa Stark y su futuro

blog.name: qinaliel
blog.title: I fumble with words and twirl unnecessarily.
blog.description: Welcome to the randomness: my photography, ASoIaF/Game of Thrones, House Stark, The Princess Bride, Kit Harington, Sophie Turner, the CHRISes, Garrett Hedlund, and anything that tickles my fancy. All photos are mine ©, unless stated otherwise (i.e. an edit) or reblogged because of the feels.

blog.name: wallofprompts
blog.title: The Wall of Prompts
blog.description: GoT prompts. Grab a prompt for a fic or left one. Main ships Jonerys and Gendrya, but everyone is welcome. Check the tags list for prompts.

title: What if...
body: After the small council meeting, where they decided to assassinate a pregnant Daenerys and Ned resigns as Hand of the King. He thinks off sailing for Dragonstone with Sansa, Arya and only a few guards to meet Stannis and try to find out why Jon Arryn was murdered… So what would have happen if they have sailed for Dragonstone?

reblog.comment: After the small council meeting, where they decided to assassinate a pregnant Daenerys and Ned resigns as Hand of the King. He thinks off sailing for Dragonstone with Sansa, Arya and only a few guards to meet Stannis and try to find out why Jon Arryn was murdered… So what would have happen if they have sailed for Dragonstone?

trail.content_raw: After the small council meeting, where they decided to assassinate a pregnant Daenerys and Ned resigns as Hand of the King. He thinks off sailing for Dragonstone with Sansa, Arya and only a few guards to meet Stannis and try to find out why Jon Arryn was murdered… So what would have happen if they have sailed for Dragonstone?

summary: The Magic of Us - Chapter 6 - Notes on the Quidditch Teams
title: The Magic of Us - Chapter 6 - Notes on the Quidditch Teams
body:
Stark Quidditch Team (aka the Year 4 Team, due to most players being in Year 4)

Seeker: Ygritte (Year 4)

Beaters (2): Robin Flint (Year 6), Smalljon Umber (Year 7; Captain)

Chasers (3): Robb Stark (Year 4), Jon Snow (Year 4), Meera Reed (Year 4)

Keeper: Lyra Mormont (Year 4)


Lannister Quidditch Team

Seeker: Talla Tarly (Year 3)

Beaters (2): Sandor (Year 1), Merlon Crakehall (Year 5)

Chasers (3): Lancel (Year 5), Bronn (Year 1), Alysanne Lefford (Year 4)

Keeper: Addam Marbrand (Year 6; Captain)

Chapter 6 is now up, and is a bit more of a plot chapter. We’ll be back to the Sansan in Chapter 7. :)
